body:
## Coding 
https://www.codecademy.com/
https://www.udemy.com/topic/python/ Good for beginner lessons
https://www.pluralsight.com/ < wide range of IT areas

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/resources/study-guides/az-900 < good starting point for Azure basics

## Beginner Certifications
Comptia A+
Comptia Network+ 
Comptia Security+ 


## Beginner Coding Exercises 
# DO NOT LOOK UP THE ANSWERS!! 
For code References, review here: https://www.w3schools.com/python/
1. write a program that outputs "Hello World!" using python
2. Fizzbuzz using python {Your program will count incrementally, replacing any number divisible by three with the word "fizz", and any number divisible by five with the word "buzz", and any number divisible by both 3 and 5 with the word "fizzbuzz". If the number does not fall into these categories, it will simply output the number. good start is going from 1-100}

Once you have completed these, feel free to email your solutions to me, and i can provide feed back and then we can go from there to add on and expand what you know. Like how to take imputs, how to use variables, how to use tuples and all that. 

Additionally, feel free to ask questions, its the only way you learn. :) \
Tyler Ellis \
tyellis1111245@gmail.com
